questions.question: There was ………………………… anything in the box.
There lay ……………………………… books on the table.
questions.description: A few indicates a small number few means almost none.

questions.question: ………………………………. the thunderstorm approaching, we rushed indoors.
……………………………. on tip-toe, he reached for the apple.
Would you mind ……………………………. the door?
questions.description: An ing form is used after would you mind.

questions.question: You ……………………………… attend the meeting.
questions.description: The modal auxiliary need is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You had better ………………………….. a doctor.
questions.description: The bare infinitive is used after had better.

questions.question: You don’t need …………………………….. all questions.
questions.description: When need is an ordinary verb, it is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: Beethoven is ……………………………… than most other composers.
I prefer watching TV …………………………… reading books.
questions.description: Prefer is followed by the preposition to.

questions.question: He is ………………………………. of my four children.
The older we grow, ………………………………. we become.
questions.description: The + comparative is used in both clauses in this structure.
